messages.content: We need to add Sentry error tracking to the task sharing endpoint. Also make sure we're using structured JSON logging with correlation IDs for request tracing.
Added Sentry.capture_exception() calls in the error handlers. Updated logging to use structured JSON format with correlation_id field in every log entry.
Good. For logging levels, log the full stack trace at ERROR level and just a summary at WARNING level. That's our standard pattern.
Updated the logging. Full stack traces now logged at ERROR level, summaries at WARNING. Also using Python's logger module, not print() - I know you don't want print statements in production code.
Exactly. Never use print() in production Python code - always use the logger. Now I want to put this feature behind a feature flag using LaunchDarkly before the demo day on the 15th.
Added LaunchDarkly feature flag 'task-sharing-enabled' that wraps the endpoint. When disabled, returns a 404. This lets us gradually roll out to users before the investor demo on the 15th.
Perfect. The demo day is next month on the 15th - we have time to test. Add error boundaries at the route level in React for the frontend portion too.
Added TaskShareErrorBoundary component and wrapped the task sharing routes. It catches errors and displays a toast notification to users instead of crashing the whole app.
